title: For Sale:  Simth & Wesson Model 27-1 357 Magnum
postcontent:
Like new gun.  with pisol Bushnell Scope.    I believe it is considered a 3 screw model.   The 2012 Blue Book of Gun Values say this gun between $600 - $700.   The experts say:  All -1 models have a 4-screw frame EXCEPT for the Model 29-1 where all but one reported (S220004) have a 3-screw frame and an extractor rod with a right-hand (old style) thread. In reality, only S220004 is a true Model 29-1. The other ones are stamped 29-1 in the yoke cut, but are not configured correctly.

Based on what I have observed over the years, the -1 model variation would best be described: 4-screw frame, extractor rod with a left-hand thread as evidenced by a small relief cut behind the knurled tip, "L" stamped on the rear surface of the cylinder, stamped MOD.XX-1 in the yoke cut.

I am only talking about models of revolvers that were stamped -1 when the extractor rod threads were changed from right-hand to left-hand as directed by the engineering change dated December 22, 1959. 


The engineering change to implement the extractor rod with the left-hand thread was issued by S&W on December 22, 1959 and resulted in revolvers with the -1 model variation. The engineering change to implement the improved cylinder stop with the elimination of the cylinder stop plunger screw was issued on November 28, 1961 and resulted in revolvers with the -2 model variation. The time it took to implement these changes was substantial as the -1 models were shipped throughout 1962 and the -2 models began in late 1962.

The change to the extractor rod with a left-hand thread was authorized in late 1959, but -1 models did not begin to be shipped until 1962 and most were shipped in that year with a few carrying over to 1963. The -2 models also appeared in late 1962, so the the -1s were really only shipped for a year plus.

The engineering directive to change the thread direction on the extractor rod (RH to LH) was issued on December 22, 1959 and took approximately two years to implement (based on what we know today...and it may change when more revolvers are discovered and documented). The engineering directive to implement the improved cylinder stop that resulted in the elimination of the cylinder stop plunger screw (i.e. 4-screw frame to 3-screw frame) was issued on November 28, 1961 and was implemented much more quickly as revolvers with a 3-screw frame began to be shipped in early 1962. That is why (some believe) Model 29-1s have a 3-screw frame as S&W had old style extractor rods and cylinders, but had made the switch to the 3-screw frame and used up the old cylinders and extractor rods on the "new" frames. I am not sure why these guns were actually stamped MOD. 29-1 in the yoke cut, but they were.

postcontent:
This Chilean Mauser has all matching numbers.  As with most military surplus rifles in early 20th certury, folks had them "sporterized" for hunting purposes.  This one has a nicely cut and shaped walnut stock, and it has no cracks or significant damage at all.  
The bore is extremely nice, and the rifle is ready to go hunting as it is.  It came to me with an M1 Garand sling, circa 1950's, and that sling comes with the rifle.
The ammo, 7 X 57, is available, and prices a bit less than .308 and .30-06 ammo.

This rifle qualifies as an antique, being built before 1898, so if shipped it will not require a FFL.  Nevertheless, buyer will be non-felon and not under indictment.
FTF sale will require $150 cash.  Shipping will be at the expense of the buyer.

title: For Sale:  M1842 US Military HARPERS FERRY 69 CALIBER MUSKET
postcontent:
Percussion smooth bore musket, all in military configuration, but the stock was shortened to the first barrel band and the barrel shortened to 38", from 42". This was most likely done at an arsenal in the late 1800s. Well marked lock reads; HARPERS FERRY 1845, with and eagle and a small US. Barrel marked VP, butt plate marked US. Fully functional, working crisp and tight. Fine walnut stock is sound, overall length 53". 

An opportunity to restore one of these rare guns, of the Civil War, from a very historical arsenal which is a tourist attraction today. Harper's Ferry was fought over and taken by both sides many times. Before that, John Brown captured it to ignite the Civil War and free the slaves...which he accomplished at the cost of his life and reputation. Patriot, or zealot? We can use a man like that again...to free us all, I think. Nice smooth patina on all metal surfaces, sound walnut stock, good original nipple, all original, ship weight is 12 pounds.






Asking $400 cash or $475 in trade

title: For Sale:  PENDING SALE 3 blackpowder guns with ammo & accessories
postcontent:
The following is a group of muzzle loading weapons, ammunition and accessories I got as part of a collection, but muzzle-loading isn't really my thing. If you ever wanted to try it, or you'd just like to add some new toys, here's everything you need to shoot black powder.

Traditions Mountaineer .50 - Here is a really nice Spanish made Traditions .50 cal muzzle Loader with a 27" Octagon rifled barrel. The bore is bright with strong rifling and the gun looks to have been shot little. The gun has a few marks on it from use but other than that the gun is in really nice shape as you can see. Nice open sights and a light crisp trigger release.

Lyman Great Plains Pistol .50 - "Lyman's Plains Pistol recreates the trapper's percussion pistol of the mid-1800's while incorporating the best of modern steels and technology. The richly stained walnut stock complements blackened iron furniture, polished brass trigger guard and ramrod tips. The hooked patent breech takes down quickly and easily for cleaning. The thimble is recessed into the rib and a detachable belt hook provides an alternative to a holster. A spring-loaded trigger and 7½" barrel with a fast 1 in 30" twist make it amazingly accurate."

Pietta 1860 Army .44 revolver + holster - The 1860 Army revolver was adopted by the U.S. Ordnance and became very popular with mounted troops because of its easy handling, superior balance and excellent ballistics. This authentic reproduction is 44 Caliber with a round barrel, brass trigger guard, 6-shot cylinder, fixed sights and one-piece walnut grip. Includes a nice leather holster.

title: For Trade:  MINT CONDITION Les Paul Ultra II + Cash Trade For AR-15
postcontent:
I am looking to trade my Epiphone Les Paul Ultra II that is a one owner guitar. I bought it brand new in march of 2011 at Daddy's Junky Music in Williston. I paid just over $800 for it and I actually have the reciept for this guitar still in my wallet. As with all Epiphone guitars, it has a lifetime transferable warranty. This guitar is in the special edition Midnight Ebony finish with all gold hardware. Has 3 pickups, 2 traditional humbuckers and a Nanomag pickup in the base of the neck that allows for electrified "acoustic" play. Has 2 output jacks, one for the Nanomag and one for the humbuckers. Its literally made to have two cables plugged into it that go to a selector box so you can jump from acoustic to electric with the tap of a button. You can also mix the acoustic and electric tones to make a unique hybrid sound. There is a seperate control panel on the back for the Nanomag and it takes a 9v battery like a normal acoustic/electric guitar. This guitar is exactly as new. Not a chip or scratch anywhere, its the best guitar I have ever owned and I treat it very well. I usually keep it in my case except for special gatherings when I play it or just show it. 

I would like to trade for an AR-15 or something of the like. Doesn't have to be ultra high eng mil spec Remington or Bushmaster, just something that functions well and can take down a coyote. I have maybe up to $400 to add to the deal, depending on rifle.

title: For Sale:  MINI DRACO PISTOL NIB
postcontent:
Mini Draco 

The Mini Draco is in a class of it's own and so I am not going say allot about it because if your looking at it your probably already know.  Near the top of the list of my all-time favorite weapons! 

Probably Collectible?  There is no doubt that this is a collectable weapon for a variety of reasons and will continue skyrocket in price.  This receiver has the "Y" "X" "I" stamp as well the magazine "Dimples" are correct deep sided just like all true Soviet style AK's have.  Obviously this weapon is made with Russian tooling specs, not like all American receivers which have non-standard low slope sidewall magazine dimples and are missing auto sear stamps "Y" "I" .  Also note that this AK is classified as a pistol and provides more compact firepower than any handgun I can think of. 

I accept Postal Money Order, Cashiers Check, Certified Check, Personal Check after clearing.

For 950.00 or best offer I am selling is an all black 5.56 NATO Mid length M4 with a 16-inch barrel, palmetto state armory upper and PSA bolt assembly. Fitted with a Magpul Mid Length hand guard. The sights; a standard A-1 iron front and a LMT rear sight. On the barrel an A2 birdcage flash suppressor.

The lower is an MGO commissioned piece made by Mega Arms. Its stamped 1 of 100 made of this particular part. It is fitted with an MOE grip, a Magpul Ambidextrous Sling Attachment Point and also a 6 position MOE Magpul collapsible stock.

Everything is milspec

2 mags one is a Magpul 30 round P Mag with window and dust cover. The other is a tango down polymer 30 round mag.

Additional Items included is a colt carrying handle with a scope mount rail. In the photo you will see a scope already on it. Its a no namer but it is included anyway. I can put in a little less than a 100 rounds of ammo on top of everything.

I piece this rifle together in a years time and now it is unfortunate that I have to sell it. Only 40 rounds exactly have been put through it to make sure it cycles smoothly and it definitely has done so. Every few weeks I re-oil the rifle. It is clear there is very little wear on the rifle and that is only due to cycling the bolt manually after oiling. title: For Sale:  NFA Gun Trust Preparation
postcontent:
Advertisement for Legal Services:  The contents of this posting are strictly informational and for the purpose of advertising legal services relating to the creation of NFA Gun Trusts by a duly licensed and experienced attorney.  Nothing contained in this advertisement constitutes legal advice and no attorney-client relationship is intended or implied.
_____________________________________________________________

The National Firearms Act (“NFA”) has special requirements for the ownership of Title II firearms, which include machine guns, sound suppressors, short-barreled shotguns, short-barreled rifles, destructive devices, and “any other weapon”.  There are different options available to those interested in purchasing a Title II firearm, including purchasing as an individual or through a trust or business entity such as a corporation or limited liability company.

The most beneficial of the foregoing options is an NFA Gun Trust.  An NFA Gun Trust is a legal instrument that provides Title II firearms collectors with certain estate planning benefits while also setting forth who will use, possess and maintain the firearms and for whose benefit they will be so maintained.  Gun Trusts have many benefits beyond those offered by other ownership options, including:

•	No fingerprint cards or photo identification required
•	Chief Law Enforcement Officer (CLEO) signature is not required
•	Continuity of ownership upon incapacitation or death
•	Several authorized users may be designated
•	Confidentiality and privacy in the ownership of the NFA assets

An NFA Gun Trust provides a means to protect owners of Title II weapons from inadvertent or constructive violation of the National Firearms Act, which regulates the transfer, possession, and ownership of Title II firearms.  The repercussions for violation of the NFA are quite serious, and can include: (i) a fine of up to $250,000, (ii) ten (10) years imprisonment, and (iii) the forfeiture of the weapon, as well as any vessel, vehicle, or aircraft used to conceal or convey the firearm. 

Protect your firearms, your family, and yourself from violations of the National Firearms Act with a professionally drafted NFA Gun Trust today.


Kevin L. Bradford is an attorney with the law firm of Nadler Nadler & Burdman Co., LPA.  He is licensed to practice law in the State of Ohio and the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.  Kevin is a former United States Army Officer, lifelong shooter and outdoorsman, and avid firearms collector.  In addition he is a Life Member of the National Rifle Association, a Patron Member of Ohioans for Concealed Carry, Member of the National Skeet Shooter’s Association, and maintains active membership and participation in both the Trumbull County Rod & Gun Club and the Mercer County Sportsmen Association. 

For More Information Please Contact:

Attorney Kevin L. Bradford

Youngstown, Ohio 44503

title: For Sale:  NIB Pre-ban Colt AR-15 Delta HBar A2 Sporter Model R6600DH
postcontent:
Colt's R6600DH Delta H-Bar version of the AR-15 is one of the most accurate versions of one of the most famous military weapons of all time. The Delta H-Bars are incredibly accurate due to their 20" heavy barrels and the fact that they were hand-picked at the test range because they shot better groupings than the other Colt AR's. This rifle has all the original Colt packaging and comes with the original aluminum carrying case. Bundled in the case is all the factory packaging, including the original sling, all the original colt paperwork, original mags, cleaning rods, Tasco scope paperwork, etc. When we say factory packaging, we mean all the way down to the factory cardboard plug that Colt placed in the barrels before shipping. Stored in a climate-controlled warehouse for over 20 years, this Delta HBar is a true treasure. 

Details:
• Colt R6600DH Bundle
• Semi-auto 5.56x45mm
• New In Box: barrel plug, plastic muzzle cap on flash hider, factory tag on barrel, plastic bag, accessory bag with two 20 round mags, manual, sling, cleaning brushes, and cleaning rods are all present.
• Bundle includes original Tasco 3-9x scope and cheekpiece
• Receiver is stamped "AR-15 A2 HBAR Sporter"
• 20" heavy barrel with 1:7" twist

Additional Charges 
Must pay both FFL dealer charges and shipping cost if sold outside Wisconsin

title: For Sale:  Kel-Tec SU-22C Rimfire Rifle 22 LR Underfolder
location: East Bend (336)692-0317, Winston Salem, North Carolina
postcontent:
SU-22


The SU-22 rifle is chambered for the popular and economical .22 Long Rifle cartridge (.22LR). It is based on the 5.56mm NATO chambered SU-16 rifle and shares many parts including the grip and front and rear sights. The SU-22 is not a simple conversion kit, it is a standalone firearm chambered for the .22LR and is designed for target shooting, plinking, or small game hunting. The PLR-22 and SU-22 operate by blowback action and have a 4140 steel bolt that rides on steel guide rails inside the polymer receiver. The ejector is attached to one of the guide rails and the recoil spring is located above the barrel. The cross-bolt safety and magazine release operate identically to the PLR-16 and SU-16.

We accept visa/mastercard/discover at a 3% loss of cash. USPS money orders/certified checks same as cash. 15.00 Shipping NC. residence pay 6.75% sales tax. You can email or call Brad with Carolina Firearms at REDACTED
